pageContext.claim: “In the first three years, we lifted 6.6 million people out of poverty.”
pageContext.analysis: The Census Bureau reported a big drop in the number of people in poverty in 2019, bringing to total decline to 5.7 million people -- not 6.6 million -- between 2016 and 2019. But then after the pandemic struck in 2020, an estimated 8 million people slipped into poverty between May and October -- a fact that Trump never mentions as he uses this brag line in rallies and interviews.
